experiment_info.name: sigma_restart_on_stagnation
experiment_info.description: If CMA-ES sigma shrinks below threshold, reset sigma and continue. Prevents premature convergence to suboptimal regions.
experiment_info.hypothesis: Resetting sigma when it shrinks might help escape local optima

reason_aborted: Prior evidence is CONCLUSIVE. Multiple restart-related experiments (IPOP, BIPOP, two-phase restart) have FAILED. Key finding: problem has NO LOCAL OPTIMA to escape. CMA-ES converges to global optimum without restarts.

ipop_cmaes_temporal.result: FAILED - IPOP not beneficial for this problem
ipop_cmaes_temporal.finding: IPOP adds time without improving accuracy

bipop_cmaes_restart.result: FAILED - BIPOP adds overhead without sufficient accuracy gain

cmaes_restart_from_best.result: FAILED - restart strategies don't help when single-phase already works
cmaes_restart_from_best.finding: Restarting from best solution wastes budget

cmaes_early_stopping.finding: CMA-ES continues making meaningful improvements (>1%) throughout budget

adaptive_sample_budget.finding: Premature termination leads to suboptimal results

key_insight: The thermal inverse problem is WELL-CONDITIONED. CMA-ES converges to the global optimum without needing restart escapes. Sigma resetting is a soft restart that would waste budget.
